bug.author: znation
bug.summary: Python unit test failure in test_json
bug.description:
Reproduced on Linux in Python 2.7; may reproduce elsewhere. <denchmark-code>_________________________ JSONTest.test_malformed_json _________________________
self = <turicreate.test.test_json.JSONTest testMethod=test_malformed_json>
def test_malformed_json(self): > self.assertRaises(IOError, SArray.read_json, './malformed.json')
test_json.py:254: _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ ../data_structures/sarray.py:585: in read_json proxy.load_from_json_record_files(_make_internal_url(filename)) turicreate/cython/cy_sarray.pyx:72: in turicreate.cython.cy_sarray.UnitySArrayProxy.load_from_json_record_files ??? _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _
> ??? E RuntimeError: Unable to parse /builds/turi/turicreate/deps/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/turicreate/test/malformed.json. It does not appear to be in JSON record format. A list of dictionaries is expected
turicreate/cython/cy_sarray.pyx:75: RuntimeError ----------------------------- Captured stdout call ----------------------------- Parsing JSON records from /builds/turi/turicreate/deps/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/turicreate/test/malformed.json --------------------------- Captured stdout teardown --------------------------- </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: This appears to be because of running the old test on the new version. Per your comments on my previous error, all these raise IOErrors now.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/hoytak>@hoytak</denchmark-link> I'm not sure what you mean re: "old test" and "new version". This failure is from a single commit of the code (), built and running tests.
